full_summary:
### [Tender Title: Exploitation & Désaffectation de Traitement de Sols – 5 Sites]

# Project Overview
Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) is undertaking remediation work at multiple sites along the Alaska Highway (Highway 97) in northern British Columbia, Canada. The project aims to bring the Maintenance Camps into alignment with the Federal Contaminated Sites Action Plan (FCSAP) goals.

## Project Locations
The project encompasses five soil treatment facilities (STFs) located across the Alaska Highway:

1. [Triple J Gravel Pit] – located approximately 2 km south of Fireside (km 834)
2. [Liard STF] – located at kilometer 763, Liard Maintenance Camp, Liard
3. [KM 713 Gravel Pit] – located at kilometer 713, approximately 15 km north of Muncho Lake
4. [Stringer STF] – located near the Toad River Maintenance Camp (km 639, Alaska Highway)
5. [Sikanni STF] – located at kilometer 254, Alaska Highway, Sikanni Maintenance Camp

## Scope of Work
Under this Contract, the selected contractor will complete the scope of work consisting of:

* Offsite disposal of contaminated soil
* Site Treatment Facility decommissioning at select sites
* Optional work: Soil screening at select sites

### Contaminants of Concern
The primary contaminants of concern in soil across all sites are petroleum hydrocarbons.
